Presented by VideoLAN President Jean-Baptiste Kempf, the demo highlighted the use of open-source AI models to generate and translate subtitles into over 100 languages completely offline, ensuring privacy and eliminating the need for cloud services. This feature is built directly into the VLC app, distinguishing it from earlier plug-ins that relied on platforms like OpenAI's Whisper. While the full rollout date hasn't been disclosed, the advancement demonstrates a significant leap in local AI integration for media playback. response_text: Here are some free (or free-tier) AI tools you can use to translate your videos:  Online translators with AI subtitles/dubbing  Canva’s AI Video Translator – easy browser-based translator with subtitles/dubbing options. Canva [https://www.canva.com/features/ai-video-translator/]  Invideo AI Video Translator – translates to 50+ languages with voice and captions. Invideo [https://invideo.io/make/video-translator/]  Wayin.ai Video Translator – auto-transcribes and translates subtitles into 100+ languages. WayinVideo [https://wayin.ai/tools/video-translator/]  BlipCut – translates videos online with voice cloning & lip sync. Video Translator [https://videotranslator.blipcut.com/]  Happy Scribe – free for first ~10 minutes of video translation/subtitles. HappyScribe [https://www.happyscribe.com/translate-video]  Rask.ai – good if you want transcription + translation + dubbing support. Rask [https://www.rask.ai/]  Other options with free usage  YouTube Auto-Translate captions – if your video is on YouTube, auto-generated captions can be translated for free. camb.ai [https://www.camb.ai/blog-post/free-ai-video-translators-best-options-and-features]  Lipsync.video – browser tool for AI voiceovers and lip sync. lipsync.video [https://lipsync.video/video-translate]  Most of these let you upload a video in your browser and get translated subtitles or dubbed audio without paying (though some may limit minutes or require signup). camb.ai [https://www.camb.ai/blog-post/free-ai-video-translators-best-options-and-features]  If you want something offline, the open-source VLC demoed AI subtitling/translation, which may be available in stable releases later. theverge.com [https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/9/24339817/vlc-player-automatic-ai-subtitling-translation]  Want suggestions based on how long your video is or whether you want subtitles vs full dubbed audio?

Perfect for global creators, educators, and marketers.","domain":"lipsync.video"},{"url":"https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/9/24339817/vlc-player-automatic-ai-subtitling-translation","title":"VLC player demos real-time AI subtitling for videos","description":"January 9, 2025 — At CES 2025, the open-source VLC media player showcased a new AI-powered feature that enables real-time subtitling and translation of videos directly on users' devices. Presented by VideoLAN President Jean-Baptiste Kempf, the demo highlighted the use of open-source AI models to generate and translate subtitles into over 100 languages completely offline, ensuring privacy and eliminating the need for cloud services. This feature is built directly into the VLC app, distinguishing it from earlier plug-ins that relied on platforms like OpenAI's Whisper.
